thread.section_title: Business Breaking News | Finance & Business News | News.com.au
thread.title: Market listings still on the rise
thread.title_full: Market listings still on the rise

author: news.com.au
title: Market listings still on the rise
text:
THE number of companies joining the share market has grown in the first half of 2015, though the value of funds raised in the process was lower.
THERE were 30 initial public offers in the six months to June, up from 22 in the same period in 2014, but they raised $2.5 billion from investors, almost half what was raised a year ago, according to research by Deloitte.
Technology, media, and telecommunications companies made up 27 per cent of those listing on the market, and accounted for 47 per cent of the value, reflecting confidence among tech companies that market listings present attractive capital growth options, Deloitte said. Corporate finance partner and head of transaction services Ian Turner said the 2014 wave of market listings, fuelled by pent up supply as companies capitalised on improving markets, has some way to run. "A strong pipeline still exists as managers and financial sponsors prepare their companies for the public markets," he said. "Despite global volatility, we are seeing strong investor confidence given the quality of IPOs. "You only have to look at the listings for the first half of 2015 and their impressive performance." The combined share price performance of companies to list in 2015 is a gain of 7.2 per cent, compared to a fall of 4.1 per cent for the ASX200 index.
